biography.summary: Lindsey O. Graham is a United States Senator from South Carolina, serving since 2003. A Republican, he has focused on national security, foreign policy, and judiciary matters, and has previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives (1995-2003).
biography.early_life: Lindsey O. Graham was born in 1955 in Central, South Carolina. He earned a law degree from the University of South Carolina and began his political career in the South Carolina House of Representatives.
biography.education: University of South Carolina School of Law, J.D., 1981.
biography.career: Graham has served in the U.S. House of Representatives (1995-2003) before being elected to the U.S. Senate in 2002 (taking office in 2003). He has been involved in foreign policy and national security, including work on defense and counterterrorism.

contact.office_address: 211 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510
